*div1 type="summary"* *p*Samuel M. Williams to W. D. D[unlap?], March 10, 1831. Acknowledging his appointment as collector at Brazoria and promising to aid him.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*I am informed by yr official Letter of the *date_mentioned n="03-02-1831">2d inst */date_mentioned*which came to hand the*date_mentioned n="03-09-1831"> 9th*/date_mentioned* of yr appt by *person_mentioned*Col J. D. Bradburn */person_mentioned*as *person_mentioned*Capt of the Port*/person_mentioned* or *person_mentioned*inspector of the tributary port of the *location_mentioned*port of Galveston called Brasoria*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* and of your arrival at *location_mentioned*Brasoria*/location_mentioned*— You may rest assured that I will cheerfully unite with you in every measure conformably with the laws to carry into effect the object of your office— By the Militia Laws of this *location_mentioned*state */location_mentioned*the *person_mentioned*Militia */person_mentioned*are under the direction of the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*that is to say if you should find the *person_mentioned*militia */person_mentioned*necessary for the performance of your duties the order must emanate from the *person_mentioned*Alcalde*/person_mentioned*— In order to prevent you from laboring under any serious disadvantages. I will call on the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*for an order addressed to the*person_mentioned* Comt of the Batalion*/person_mentioned* to furnish *person_mentioned*Militia */person_mentioned*whenever necessary— altho I hope and trust they will not be necessary*/p*
*p*Accept the assurances of my respect and esteem and desires for your success in the discharge of yr duties *date_mentioned n="03-10-1831">10 March 1831*/date_mentioned* *person_mentioned*WDD.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Samuel M. Williams.]*/p*
*/div1*
